element.title: Combobox
element.longdescription:
Note: Redmond components are deprecated. Please consider using LZ Components. If you use this component, you must explicitly include the redmond library:
<include href="redmond"/>

Description:
The combobox tag provides a basic redmond style combobox with an editable text field and a drop-down list. The datapath attribute sets the text for the editable text field, and the itemfield attribute is the path to an item of a dataset to be displayed in the drop-down list. When the list is visible it will show all of its items unless the attribute shownitems is set to a number less than that.

Example:
<canvas height="160">
    
    <include href="redmond" />

    <dataset name="namelist" >
        <item>Susan</item>
        <item>Bob</item>
        <item>Carol</item>
        <item>Steven</item>
        <item>Anne</item>
    </dataset>
    
    <combobox x="10" y="50" width="152" shownitems="4" 
              itemfield="nameList:/item/text()" 
              datapath="nameList:/item[1]/text()" 
              name="mycombo" > 
    </combobox>

</canvas>

attribute.name: shownitems
attribute.desc: The maximum number items to show in the list that drops down. If the number of items in the list is greater than shownitems, the list scrolls.

attribute.name: itemfield
attribute.desc: The path to an item from a dataset that will be displayed in the list.
